bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Sidney Wallach, July 31, 1950

div1.p: Hench inquires about the project Wallach had proposed. Hench had suggested that Wallach enlist the help of the Walter Reed Memorial Association.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Sidney Wallach, July 31, 1950
div1.opener:
Yellow
Fever
July 31, 1950
Mr. Sidney Wallach
381 Fourth Avenue
New York 16, New York
My dear Mr. Wallach:
div1.p:
Have you done anything in regard to your project?
You remember my suggestion was that you should contact the
Walter Reed Memorial Association which comprises
those men perhaps most interested in the memory
of Walter Reed. I think they told you they have
some definite ideas about your project and if
you could enlist their help as a group, that
would be quite important.

Pardon my long delay in answering your
letter. I have been in and out of town so much that
I am way behind in my correspondence which is very
excessive.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH: alc
